author: i24NEWS
title: Hamas Announces It Has Agreed To Proposed Ceasefire And Hostage Deal With Israel - I24NEWS
text: Hamas announces it has agreed to ceasefire and hostage deal, Israel cautions terms are unknown Israeli official to i24NEWS: "For now there is no agreed framework" on hostage and ceasefire deal with Hamas Palestinian terrorist group Hamas has announced it has agreed to a proposed ceasefire and hostage deal with Israel proposed by Egypt and Qatar, according to a statement by the group on Monday evening. The announcement comes hours after the IDF had announced civilian evacuations in Rafah ahead of a planned offensive in southern Gaza. An Israeli official told i24NEWS that the government is, "checking which ceasefire formula Hamas has agreed." Another Israeli government official told Kann, "We received Hamas' answer. The negotiating team is now studying it." The terrorist organization said in an official statement: "The head of the Hamas political bureau, Ismail Haniya, spoke by phone with the Prime Minister of Qatar - Mohammed bin Abd al-Rahman al-Thani, and with the head of Egyptian intelligence - Abbas Kamal, and informed them that Hamas agrees to their proposal for a ceasefire fire." The agreement, if completed, is expected to include a six week ceasefire in Gaza, the release of over 30 Israeli hostages held by Hamas, and the release of hundreds of Palestinian prisoners held in Israel. This is a developing story

text:
Tres motochorros roban una motocicleta a un hombre en CapiatÃ¡
Una cÃ¡mara de circuito cerrado captÃ³ el momento cuando tres delincuentes, a bordo de dos motocicletas, robaron un biciclo a un trabajador que regresaba a su vivienda en CapiatÃ¡, Departamento Central.
Tres motochorros despojaron de su motocicleta a un trabajador en el barrio Santa Rosa de CapiatÃ¡.

author: @cronista
title: El Gobierno premiarÃ¡ con aumentos de sueldo a los funcionarios que mÃ¡s ajusten: la dura respuesta de ATE - El Cronista
text:
El Gobierno premiarÃ¡ con aumentos de sueldo a los funcionarios que mÃ¡s ajusten: la dura respuesta de ATE
La iniciativa, publicada en el BoletÃ­n Oficial, fue rechazada por el gremio, que volviÃ³ a convocar aun paro con movilizaciÃ³n.
La decisiÃ³n del Gobierno nacional de "premiar" con aumentos de sueldo a los funcionarios que reduzcan el personal de sus Ã¡reas generÃ³ un fuerte malestar en los gremios estatales, que este jueves volvieron a convocar a un paro con movilizaciÃ³n.
La DecisiÃ³n Administrativa 7/25 de la Jefatura de Gabinetes, publicada el Ãºltimo miÃ©rcoles en el BoletÃ­n Oficial, establece que se podrÃ¡n asignar unidades retributivas adicionales a los funcionarios que hayan reducido su personal.
El beneficio se aplicarÃ¡ las "autoridades superiores incorporadas al rÃ©gimen de Gabinete de Asesores", y responde a la necesidad de "evaluar el desempeÃ±o" de los funcionarios.
En el anexo de la normativa se especificÃ³ la cantidad de recursos que percibirÃ¡ cada miembro del Ejecutivo para repartir entre las autoridades y se aclarÃ³ que el otorgamiento estarÃ¡ supervisado por Federico Sturzenegger y otros organismos tÃ©cnicos de EconomÃ­a.
Para ATE se trata, lisa y llanamente, de un plan de incentivos para despedir empleados estatales.
"Esta gente vino al Estado sÃ³lo a llenar sus bolsillos. Ahora les van a aumentar el sueldo a los funcionarios que mÃ¡s despidan. Esto no pasÃ³ nunca. Son mercenarios que cobran por hacer el trabajo sucio. Se apoderaron del Estado CEOs fracasados que nos estÃ¡n costando muy caro a todos los argentinos", apuntÃ³ Rodolfo Aguiar, Secretario General del gremio.
AdemÃ¡s, denunciÃ³ que se trata de un desvÃ­o de fondos en detrimento del pueblo, ya que el supuesto ahorro que busca generar el Gobierno con los despidos irÃ¡ a parar al bolsillo de funcionarios de segunda o tercera lÃ­nea hasta alcanzar la remuneraciÃ³n de ministro.
Los estatales, que este jueves volvieron a movilizarse al Ministerio de DesregulaciÃ³n y TransformaciÃ³n del Estado, reclaman ademÃ¡s la renovaciÃ³n automÃ¡tica de los mÃ¡s de 50 mil contratos que vencen a fin de mes.
"Rechazamos cualquier posibilidad de que pretendan compensar el costo fiscal de la rebaja de retenciones al campo y la eliminaciÃ³n de impuestos a la compra de autos de alta gama con nuevos despidos masivos", reclamÃ³ el gremio.
Mercados
Precio del dÃ³lar hoy y dÃ³lar blue hoy: cuÃ¡l es la cotizaciÃ³n del jueves 27 de marzo minuto a minuto
CuÃ¡l es el precio del dÃ³lar oficial y de los dÃ³lares financieros CCL y MEP.
Toda la informaciÃ³n que necesitas sobre cÃ³mo sigue la semana en los mercados.
Bonos, acciones, riesgo paÃ­s, Cedears, plazos fijos.

author: Sophie Austin
title: California voters to weigh proposal to ban forced prison labor in state constitution | KPBS Public Media
text: California voters to weigh proposal to ban forced prison labor in state constitution California voters will decide in November whether to remove an exemption for involuntary servitude from the state constitution under a proposal the state Legislature approved Thursday. In California and many other states, the state constitution bans involuntary servitude except as a punishment for crime. The proposed amendment would change the constitution to say that â€œslavery and involuntary servitude are prohibited.â€ Proponents of the measure want the state to [outlaw forced prison labor](https://apnews.com/article/politics-united-states-government-california-nevada-constitutions-cd220ed1abfd63c5971ee1394756c7e7) in which people who are incarcerated are often paid less than $1 an hour to fight fires, clean prison cells and do yardwork at cemeteries. â€œIncarcerated people's relationship to work should not be one of exploitation and little-to-no agency,â€ said Democratic Assemblymember Lori Wilson, who authored the proposal. â€œLet us take this step to restore some dignity and humanity and prioritize rehabilitative services for the often-forgotten individuals behind bars.â€ The proposed constitutional amendment passed overwhelmingly in the Senate, with a few Republicans voting against it. The state Assembly quickly gave the measure final approval in the Legislature, meaning it now heads to voters. The proposal is a part of a [package of reparations bills](https://apnews.com/article/california-reparations-compensation-slavery-c3b8d7a4de973adf218b93e396af8fe1) introduced by the California Legislative Black Caucus. Lawmakers announced the package earlier this year as part of an effort for the state to atone and offer redress for a history of racism and discrimination against Black Californians. California has a long legacy of involuntary servitude that still lingers today with people who are incarcerated who are forced to work often facing the threat of punishment if they refuse, said state Sen. Steven Bradford, a Los Angeles-area Democrat. â€œToday, we have the opportunity to take a step in the right direction towards ending that legacy,â€ he said. The state Senate rejected a similar proposal in 2022. Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom's administration [opposed the measure](https://apnews.com/article/prisons-california-gavin-newsom-minimum-wage-slavery-a0aed840fc6dc54c7eb0da98d0f6bb05), warning it could cost taxpayers billions of dollars if the state had to pay people in prison a $15 hourly minimum wage. Several states, including Alabama, Oregon, Tennessee and Vermont, have in recent years approved amendments to their constitutions to remove slavery and involuntary servitude exceptions. The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution has a similar exception to California for slavery and involuntary servitude as a â€œpunishment for crimeâ€ if the person has been â€œduly convicted.â€ Democrats in Congress have failed in recent years to pass a [proposal to remove the exemption](https://apnews.com/article/or-state-wire-race-and-ethnicity-lifestyle-juneteenth-963c58a1a19ba501f5677343b9c786e0). State Sen. Lola Smallwood-Cuevas, a Democrat representing Culver City near Los Angeles, said the California proposal is a â€œlong-overdueâ€ reform and that it is unacceptable for people who are incarcerated to be put to work for such low pay. â€œIt undermines everyone's ability to earn a living wage in California,â€ she said. â€œIt also normalizes exploitation. It normalizes indignity and inhumanity.â€

author: A. Smith
title: Toddler hospitalized after overdosing on THC edibles, mother arrested in Coweta County
text:
Written by: A. Smith
Published February 20, 2025 @ 5:02 PM ET
COWETA COUNTY, Ga. â€“ A Coweta County mother has been arrested after her 2-year-old child overdosed on THC edibles, according to authorities.
On January 15, 2025, deputies with the Coweta County Sheriffâ€™s Office responded to a home on the 400 block of Deep South Road around 11:06 a.m. after being requested to assist EMS with a reported overdose.
The child was found experiencing symptoms including wooziness, difficulty walking and drowsiness after consuming an unknown amount of THC gummies. First responders transported the toddler to Childrenâ€™s Healthcare of Atlanta in emergency status.
The childâ€™s mother, Kimberly Turner , told deputies that she regularly consumes THC edibles and vapes. She said she took one edible that morning with her coffee but may have left an open container of â€œSUMO THC Ediblesâ€ on the kitchen counter. The product, labeled as containing 420 milligrams of THC per gummy, was reportedly within the childâ€™s reach.
Turner stated that she left the child unattended for an extended period while she went to the restroom. When she returned, she found the toddler actively eating the edibles. She estimated that the child consumed approximately 10 gummies around 11 a.m. Turner told her mother-in-law, who immediately called 911.
During the investigation, deputies found several THC gummies on the floor near a gun safe where Turner claimed she typically stored them. Officers also found three THC vape pens in plain view on top of the safe, which stood about 4 1/2 feet tall. A field test confirmed the presence of THC in the vapes. Turner provided deputies with the remaining THC edibles, with only nine left from the original 25-count bottle. The productâ€™s packaging noted: â€œExtremely potent. Go easy- adult use 21+ only, WARNING: keep out of reach of children.â€
When questioned, Turner admitted to understanding the dangers of THC exposure for young children and acknowledged that her actions were negligent. She initially denied taking an edible that morning but later admitted to consuming one after deputies observed signs of THC impairment, including bloodshot eyes, dilated pupils and slowed cognitive function.
Turner was arrested and booked into the Coweta County Jail. The childâ€™s grandmother accompanied the toddler to the hospital. The childâ€™s father, who returned home from work after being notified of the incident, told deputies that Turnerâ€™s THC â€œaddictionâ€ had caused ongoing issues in their marriage. He stated that he did not purchase the THC products for her and was unaware of her online purchases from California.
The Georgia Division of Family and Children Services (DFCS) has been notified and is investigating the incident. The childâ€™s current condition remains unknown.
The Coweta County Sheriffâ€™s Office has not released additional details as the investigation is ongoing.
Officerâ€™s Narrative:
[Please note: The following is a direct transcription from the official initial incident report. The Georgia Gazette does not fix any spelling or grammatical errors that may exist. Any changes or redactions made by our staff are placed inside brackets. Some errors may exist. All subjects are innocent until proven guilty in a court of law. The topics discussed may be sensitive to some readers. Discretion is advised.]
On the day of January 15, 2025 at approximately 1106 hours I, DS C. Wilson, was requested to assist Coweta County EMS in regards to an overdose involving a 2 year old child at [400 BLOCK] Deep South Road In Coweta County. Upon arrival I was advised that EMS would be transporting the child, [REDACTED BY AGENCY] to CHOA â€œChildrens Hospitalâ€ in Atlanta in an emergency status due to the child having consumed an unknown amount of THC edibles and had already been actively experiencing Symptoms such as Wooziness, unsteady on feet, and sleepy like symptoms.
I spoke with the mother (suspect), Kimberly Turner, who invited me into the residence. Turner advised me that she takes THC Edibles and vapes, she woke up this morning around 7 AM where she went to the kitchen, took her â€œSUMO THC EDIBLESâ€ which are labeled as 420mg per gummy, THC-A/THC-P/Delta-9, which she orders online, she said she took 1 of them with her coffee. She said that she believes she left the 2/3â€™s full (25 Count) open bottle of edibles on the kitchen counter within reach of her 2 year old child, before then leaving the kitchen entirely while simultaneously leaving the child unattended for a lengthy period of time due to Turner stating that she had an upset stomach and needed to go to the rest room. Turner stated that upon getting out of the rest room she went into the living room where she found [REDACTED BY AGENCY] actively eating the THC edibles. She stated she believed he ate roughly 10 of them at approximately 1100 hours. She told her mother, [WITNESS #1], what had happened and [WITNESS #1] immediately called 911.
I asked Turner to show me where she typically kept the THC edibles and she told me in the gun safe, and pointed to the safe that was in the dining room area. I observed on the ground near the safe several THC edible gummies just laying in the open. As well as 3 THC vape pens in plain view on top of the gun safe that was approximately 4 and a half feet tall. I took those items and secured them for evidence purpose. A rapid detect test kit used on the THC vapes, and they did indicate a positive result for THC and no result whatsoever for CBD. Turner also provided me with the bottle which contains the majority of THC edibles and there were a total of 9 of them remaining from the original 25. The bottle of THC edibles clearly states in plain writing â€œExtremely potent. Go easy- adult use 21+ only, WARNING: keep out of reach of childrenâ€.
I asked Turner if she understood the substantial dangers present if a 2 year old child were to take the THC edibles and she told me yes. I asked her if she believed her actions were negligent and she told me yes. Initially turner had told me she had not taken any of the edibles herself, however after making observations of her physical appearance (Bloodshot glassed eyes, extremely dilated pupils) to include her having a slowed thought process and struggling to recollect events that had taken place this same morning. I told her I knew she had taken THC to some extent and that was when she admitted to having taken them early this morning after waking up. Turner was placed under arrest and [WITNESS #1] was transported with the 2 year old child to CHOA childrenâ€™s hospital. I read Turner her Miranda Rights and she told me she understood them.
I spoke with [WITNESS #1] and asked for her side of the events. She said that she was inside her residence when she was notified by her daughter in Law Kimberly Turner that [REDACTED BY AGENCY] had eaten THC edibles. [WITNESS #1] immediately called 911 and requested EMS to be in route. That was [WITNESS #1]â€™s involvement of the incident. [WITNESS #1] was released from the scene and she was transported along side [REDACTED BY AGENCY] to CHOA.
I made contact with Turnerâ€™s husband [WITNESS #2], [REDACTED BY AGENCY] father, and requested he return from work in Peachtree City Georgia, to his residence so I could speak with him. [WITNESS #2] arrived approximately 20 minutes later and I advised him of the incident that had took place. He immediately became infuriated and went on a spill about Kimberlyâ€™s THC addiction and the issues it has caused in their marriage ranging from Infidelity on Turnerâ€™s behalf, as well as poor judgement by her. He told me that he does not buy the THC products for her and that she orders them online from California with funds that he has not been made aware of. During my conversation with [WITNESS #2] he appeared to have a sound mind, and did not appear to be under the influence of any form of substance.
Ultimately Turner was transported to the Coweta County Jail where she was booked. The current condition of the child is unknown.
DFCS was contacted and I spoke with Operator [REDACTED] and informed her of the details of the incident.
[End of Narrative]
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: Lev Facher
title: NIH director voices support for head of addiction research institute | STAT
text:
The director of the National Institutes of Health gave a ringing endorsement to the nationâ€™s top addiction researcher, Nora Volkow, this week in his first public remarks on the drug overdose crisis â€” a potential signal that her position as leader of the National Institute on Drug Abuse is, at least for now, secure.
Speaking at the Rx and Illicit Drug Summit in Nashville, Tenn., this week, the NIHâ€™s newly installed director, Jay Bhattacharya, told the audience that he was â€œproudâ€ of her and NIDAâ€™s work.
While the Trump administration has never specifically called Volkowâ€™s credentials or job security into question, Bhattacharyaâ€™s remarks come at a time of deep uncertainty for the agency.

author: Miguel Alfonso Caramoan
title: TNT Era? Why we think RHJ and Calvin Oftana may sweep the Commissioner's Cup awards - ESPN
text:
As the Commissioner's Cup nears its conclusion, the league is set to name its top local player and most dominant import during Friday's Game 4 of the finals.
The race for both awards has been narrowed, with the top five locals in terms of statistical points qualifying for the Best Player of the Conference plum and the four reinforcements that made the semifinals comprise the candidates for the Best Import award.
There's still a chance for the players in the finals to better their numbers and receive the hardware. With the finals battle of Ginebra and TNT intensifying, let's take a look at another race for the two awards and predict who ultimately gets it.
Best Player of the Conference race
Who we thinks win: Calvin Oftana (TNT Tropang Giga)
After the semifinals, San Miguel's June Mar Fajardo (42.0 SP) continued to lead the statistical points ranking even though the Beermen did not make the playoffs. Fajardo's averages of 20.1 points, 16.3 rebounds, and 3.5 assists on 50% field goal shooting speaks for itself. But the chances of him winning another BPC -- and that of second placed Robert Bolick (37.1 SP) of NLEX -- is low because neither player's team made the postseason.
The field further narrowed after Jordan Heading (32.6 SP, ranked fourth) and Converge were eliminated in the quarterfinals. It has become a race between the marquee players who led their respective squads to the semifinals in NorthPort's Arvin Tolentino and TNT's Calvin Oftana.
Arguably the most potent scorer in the eliminations, Tolentino led NorthPort to the best offense in the league. Unfortunately, there was a dip in his performance during the semifinals against Ginebra that lowered down his averages by a bit, but still was impressive. He averaged 20.3 points, 7.3 rebounds, and 3.9 assists on 50 TS% in 18 games. This resulted in Tolentino having the third highest statistical points among locals for the conference.
Oftana's argument to get the BPC award is about his efficiency. It also felt like the first conference where he's put up 17 points, six rebounds, and 2.1 assists on 57.6 TS%. He's also the league leader in this conference in terms of triples made per game at 3.1 while shooting an excellent 43.3% from beyond the arc. Just like Tolentino, the development of Oftana as an elite three-level scorer has made him a fixture with Gilas Pilipinas and considerably one of the most versatile wings the PBA can offer.
Although Oftana is the lowest in the statistical points category, no one on the list can say that they are a few wins away from yet another championship other than Oftana. It makes a good argument that his numbers translate to winning, which proves his value as one the best players in the league.
Best Import of the Conference race
Who we think wins: Rondae Hollis-Jefferson (TNT Tropang Giga)
TNT's Rondae Hollis-Jefferson surged to the top of the Best Import race after the semifinals, moving from seventh after the eliminations to first place with 52.7 SP. He averaged 28.2 points, 12.4 rebounds, and 5.0 assists per game while also leading all imports in blocks with 1.8 per contest. His two-way dominance and ability to take over games in crunch time make him the heavy favorite for the award.
NorthPort's Kadeem Jack (49.8 SP) sits in second place among the four imports, averaging an explosive 31.8 points, 10.7 rebounds, and 2.0 assists per game. Jack's offensive brilliance was one of the highlights of the conference, but NorthPort's early exit in the semifinals may hinder his chances of winning the award.
Rain or Shine's Deon Thompson followed at third place, putting up 19.8 points, 9.9 rebounds, and 3.8 assists per game. While his consistency was crucial for his team, he lacked the dominant impact of the frontrunners. Meanwhile, Ginebra's Justin Brownlee finished fourth with 23.3 points, 8.9 rebounds, and 4.8 assists. Brownlee's legacy in the league is unquestioned, but this conference's numbers were slightly overshadowed by the other contenders.
Hollis-Jefferson's case is the strongest, as he is not only the statistical leader among imports but also the most impactful in a winning environment. His scoring, rebounding, and defensive versatility have powered TNT into the finals, proving that he is the most deserving candidate for the Best Import award.

author: Ankit Banerjee
title: Kolkata Weather Update, KKR vs MI, IPL 2024 Match 60: Rain Likely to Play SPOILSPORT - Check FORECAST
text:
/ .verified-article img {display:inline-block;margin-right:5px;} @media screen and (max-width:766px){.common-all-content .verified-article img {width:25px!important;}} span.verified-article {background: #3aa84f1f;border-radius: 15px; padding-right: 10px;color: #3aa84f;display: inline-block;margin-bottom: 10px;} / virified logo / Kolkata Weather Update Kolkata: While IPL Match no 60 may not hold much importance for Mumbai Indians as they are eliminated from the playoff race, but for Kolkata Knight Rider â€“ the game is important as they would love to consolidate the top spot knowing that finishing in the top two would give them a second shot at making the summit clash.
But unfortunately, there are predictions of rain playing spoilsport in the city. There is a 70 per cent chance of precipitation which means it will rain at some point. To make things worse, the humidity would be around 82 per cent.
KKR Probable XI: Phil Salt (wk), Sunil Narine, Angkrish Raghuvanshi, Shreyas Iyer (c), Venkatesh Iyer, Rinku Singh, Andre Russell, Ramandeep Singh, Mitchell Starc, Varun Chakaravarthy, Harshit Rana [Impact sub: Vaibhav Arora/Manish Pandey]
MI Probable XI: Ishan Kishan (wk), Rohit Sharma, Naman Dhir, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya (c), Tim David, Anshul Kamboj/Luke Wood, Piyush Chawla, Jasprit Bumrah, Nuwan Thushara. [Impact sub: Dewald Brevis/Romario Shepherd]
